div.script:
$(document).ready(function () {
        var logConsole = function (str) {
            console.log(str);
        };
        if ($('#tabPortlet_334055 .divTabEdit').val() == "True") {
            var isModern = ('True');
            if(isModern.toLowerCase() == "true")
            {
                var tabObj = $('#tabPortlet_334055 ');
                var tabM = $('#ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl28_divTabs').attr('portlet') == 'tab';

                function activate() {
                    $(tabObj).scrollingTabs({                 
                        tabs: [{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl28_divTabs_0","title":"Coronavirus Information","content":"Full information on COVID19, better known as Coronavirus can be found below
\n
\nSuperintendent Letter on Coronavirus
\n
\nLetter from NJ Department of Health
\n
\nCoronavirus Factsheet
\n
\nCDC Coronavirus website with latest updates
\n
\nEO110 Essential Personnel Childcare flyer 3-25-20F.pdf
","active":true,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl28_divTabs_1","title":"AHES Distance Learning","content":"AHES Distance Learning begins Tuesday, March 17th.  Please see the \"Highly Anticipated Questions\" document below. 
\n
\nPlease email homehelp@ahes.k12.nj.us with any questions.  
\n
\nHighly Anticipated Questions and Answers.pdf
","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl28_divTabs_2","title":"Free/ Reduced Lunch During School Closure","content":"UPDATED- April 8, 2020
\n
\nDear Parents/Guardians,
\n
\nIf your child is eligible for free or reduced lunch through Atlantic Highlands Elementary
\nSchool, grab and go lunches will be available for pickup twice per week. AHES will be distributing these box lunches at the school on the days and times listed below:
\n
\nPickup Days/Times: MONDAY AND WEDNESDAYS ONLY, 11:00am- 12:00pm
\nLocation: Atlantic Highlands Elementary School- elevator entrance on E. Washington
\nAvenue
\n
\nMonday pickups will contain 2 days of lunches.  Wednesday pickups will contain 3 days of lunches.  
\n
\n​Lunches will not be distributed during Spring Break (Friday, April 10th- Friday, April 17th). 
\n
\nIf you have any questions or concerns, please email homehelp@ahes.k12.nj.us.
\n
\nSincerely,
\nAtlantic Highlands School District","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl28_divTabs_3","title":"2020-2021 Kindergarten Registration ","content":"
\n
\n
\nKindergarten Registration is POSTPONED until further notice. 
\n
\n2020-2021 Kindergarten Registration Packet.pdf
\n
\n
","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl28_divTabs_4","title":"2020-2021 Preschool Registration ","content":"
\n
\nAHES Preschool Registration Information: \n\n
\n
Preschool Open House- Thursday, January 23rd at 3:15pm.  Come in and meet our amazing teachers and learn more about our programs. \n\n
\n\n
\n
Preschool Registration begins- Tuesday, January 28th at 8:00am.  Registration must be done in person in the main office of the school.  Priority is given to current students and Atlantic Highlands residents until Friday, February 3rd.  Out of district applications will be accepted beginning January 28th but will be held for processing until February 3rd.   Any questions please call the main office.\n\n\n
\n
Registration packets can be printed out below-\n2020-2021 Preschool Registration Packet- AH Residents Only.pdf\n2020-2021 Preschool Registration Packet- Out of District.pdf\n\n","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl28_divTabs_5","title":"Atlantic Highlands 2019 Assessment Presentation","content":"
Please click through the slideshow to view the Spring 2019 Board of Education Standardized Assessment Presentation.
\n
\n\n
\n
","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl28_divTabs_6","title":"Field Testing Letter","content":"Please read the letter below from Dr. Compton regarding AHES's participation in the English Language Arts Field Test for the Spring 2020 New Jersey Learning Assessment:
\n
\nField Testing Letter.pdf
","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl28_divTabs_7","title":"2014-2019 AHES Strategic Plan ","content":"Please click here for the 2014-2019 AHES Strategic Plan.  ","active":false,"disabled":false}],// required,
                        propPaneId: 'paneId', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propTitle: 'title', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propActive: 'active', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propDisabled: 'disabled', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propContent: 'content', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        tabMode : tabM,
                        scrollToTabEdge: false, // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        disableScrollArrowsOnFullyScrolled: false // optional- pass in default value for demo purposes
                    }).on('ready.scrtabs', function() {
                        $('#'+this.id+' .tab-pane').attr('tabindex',0);
                    });
                };

                activate();
            }
        }
    });

div.h3: Profile of a Graduate and Strategic Planning
div.p: The Henry Hudson Tri-District is about to embark upon the development of our Profile of a Graduate and a Tri-District Strategic Plan, and we would like you to join us in this effort.

div.a: Learn More about Profile of a Graduate and Strategic Planning

div.p: We are excited to introduce our new principal. Please read her introductory letter and welcome Lori Skibinski to the AHES family...

div.p: Our Mission: The mission of the Atlantic Highlands School District is to provide an education that successfully meets the needs of our student population and effectively prepares each child for the future...

div.a: Learn More about description

p.style: font-size: 16px; line-height: 23px; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-family: latoregular;

span.style: font-size: medium; -webkit-text-stroke-color: initial; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.style: font-size: medium; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: My name is Lori Skibinski and it is my great pleasure to introduce myself as the incoming principal of Atlantic Highlands Elementary School. From the moment I entered the halls of this special learning community, I felt a profound connection to the environment and wanted so deeply for it to become my new home...

div.a: Read More... about A Message from the Principal

div.p: Front Row L-R Erin Dougherty, Karin Masina, Elisabeth Eittreim, Randi Zamkotowicz, Julie Mahoney Back Row L-R Suzanne Santry, Alyson Denzler, Conor Barnes, Steve Lombardi
